storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform shift template creation to achieve reusable scheduling.

functional.title: Verify successful creation of shift template with valid start time, end time, and break times
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role and has permissions to create shift templates
User is on the Shift Template Management page at /shift-templates
Database has less than 100 existing shift templates to ensure performance
System time is synchronized and displaying correct timezone

steps.action: Click on the 'Create New Template' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Shift template creation form modal opens with empty fields for Template Name, Start Time, End Time, and Break Times

steps.action: Enter 'Morning Shift' in the Template Name field
steps.expectedResult: Text 'Morning Shift' appears in the Template Name field with no validation errors

steps.action: Select '08:00 AM' from the Start Time dropdown picker
steps.expectedResult: Start Time field displays '08:00 AM' and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Select '05:00 PM' from the End Time dropdown picker
steps.expectedResult: End Time field displays '05:00 PM' and system validates that end time is after start time

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button and enter break time from '12:00 PM' to '01:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Break time entry appears showing '12:00 PM - 01:00 PM' with option to remove, and system validates break falls within shift hours

steps.action: Click the 'Save Template' button at the bottom of the form
steps.expectedResult: Green success banner appears at top of page displaying 'Shift template created successfully' and modal closes automatically

steps.action: Verify the newly created template appears in the templates list
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Morning Shift' is visible in the list showing Start Time: 08:00 AM, End Time: 05:00 PM, Break: 12:00 PM - 01:00 PM

postconditions: New shift template 'Morning Shift' is saved in ShiftTemplates database table with all entered details
Template appears in the list of all shift templates on the management page
Administrator remains logged in and on the Shift Template Management page
Template is available for use in scheduling workflows

functional.title: Verify creation of shift template with multiple break periods
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with shift template creation permissions
User is on the Shift Template Management page
No existing template with the same name exists in the system

steps.action: Click 'Create New Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Template creation form opens with all required fields visible

steps.action: Enter 'Extended Day Shift' in Template Name field, set Start Time to '07:00 AM' and End Time to '07:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: All fields populate correctly and show 12-hour shift duration

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button and add first break from '10:00 AM' to '10:15 AM'
steps.expectedResult: First break entry appears with times '10:00 AM - 10:15 AM' and validation passes

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button again and add second break from '01:00 PM' to '02:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Second break entry appears below first break showing '01:00 PM - 02:00 PM' with no overlap validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button again and add third break from '04:30 PM' to '04:45 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Third break entry appears showing '04:30 PM - 04:45 PM' and all three breaks are displayed in chronological order

steps.action: Click 'Save Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Shift template created successfully' appears and template is saved with all three breaks

postconditions: Template 'Extended Day Shift' is saved with three separate break periods in the database
Template appears in the list showing all break times correctly
System maintains break time sequence and validation rules

functional.title: Verify API endpoint POST /api/shift-templates creates template and returns correct response

steps.expectedResult: Template exists in database with all fields matching the request payload

steps.action: Verify template appears in UI templates list after page refresh
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Night Shift' is visible in the Shift Template Management page with correct times

postconditions: Template is persisted in ShiftTemplates database table
API response provides complete template object with generated ID
Template is immediately available for use in scheduling operations
System maintains data consistency between API and UI

userStoryObject.title: As Administrator, I want to perform shift template creation to achieve reusable scheduling.
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
The ability to create shift templates is essential for streamlining the scheduling process. This feature allows administrators to define shifts that can be reused, reducing the time spent on scheduling.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, scheduling is done manually without templates, leading to inconsistencies and increased workload.

DESIRED STATE:
Administrators can create and manage templates, ensuring consistency and efficiency in scheduling.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
â€¢ Create new shift templates with start and end times.
â€¢ Define break times within templates.
â€¢ Edit existing templates as needed.
â€¢ Delete templates that are no longer in use.

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. Administrator navigates to the shift template management page.
2. Administrator clicks on 'Create New Template'.
3. Administrator inputs shift details (start time, end time, breaks).
4. Administrator saves the template.
5. System confirms template creation.
6. Administrator can view the list of created templates.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
â€¢ Data source: ShiftTemplates table in the database.
â€¢ Validation rules: Ensure start time is before end time.
â€¢ API endpoints: POST /api/shift-templates for creation.
â€¢ Security: Only authorized administrators can create templates.
â€¢ Performance: System should handle up to 100 templates without performance degradation.

OUT OF SCOPE:
â€¢ Employee-specific scheduling is not included in this story.

SUCCESS METRICS:
â€¢ 90% of templates created without errors.
acceptanceCriteria: System allows creation of shift templates with valid start and end times.
System validates break times and ensures they do not overlap with shift times.
System displays a confirmation message upon successful template creation.
System lists all created templates for review.
